description: Discriminants of imaginary quadratic fields with class number 2 (negated).
comments: Includes only fundamental discriminants. The list of non-fundamental imaginary quadratic discriminants with class number 2 (negated) is 32, 36, 48, 60, 64, 72, 75, 99, 100, 112, 147. [From _Andrew V. Sutherland_, Apr 08 2010]
references: H. Cohen, Course in Computational Alg. No. Theory, Springer, 1993, p. 229.
links: A. Abatzoglou, A. Silverberg, A. V. Sutherland, A, Wong, A framework for deterministic primality proving using elliptic curves with complex multiplication, arXiv preprint arXiv:1404.0107, 2014
Rick L. Shepherd, Binary quadratic forms and genus theory, Master of Arts Thesis, University of North Carolina at Greensboro, 2013
Eric Weisstein's World of Mathematics, Class Number.
Index entries for sequences related to quadratic fields
mathematica: Union[ (-NumberFieldDiscriminant[ Sqrt[-#]] &) /@ Select[ Range[500], NumberFieldClassNumber[ Sqrt[-#]] == 2 &]] (* _Jean-Fran√ßois Alcover_, Jan 04 2012 *)
author: Eric Rains (rains(AT)caltech.edu)
